jobDescription: We are looking for an experienced organizational development consultant to join our HR team in building an incredible culture that drives engagement, development, and high performance throughout our workforce. In this highly consultative role, you will conceive, design, and implement solutions to advance the capabilities of employees across all levels and parts of the company. Leading efforts such as performance management, pulse surveys, and leadership development, you will drive change for real-time opportunities and problems.  Responsibilities: Build and lead customized adult learning programs that drive short-term and long-term changeFacilitate training for existing programs (e.g., interview training, goal setting, performance management) and custom programs (e.g., leadership projects, culture initiatives, various workshops)Promote and lead annual pulse survey, drive employee participation, analyze and present results, and provide recommendations for next stepsLead performance management process that includes setting goals, providing feedback, and performance evaluationsOversee branding, administration and facilitation of The Leadership Project, an internal program of workshops, events and other experiences designed to strengthen managers and build a leadership communityMeet with managers and individual contributors for coaching and consulting around business needsContinually identify business/employee opportunities and provide solutions to meet themServe as a member of the larger HR team on projects as needed Requirements: At least 5 years of solid OD experience, building programs based in adult learning conceptsA bachelor’s degree in OD, HR, Marketing, or Business (master’s degree preferred)A curious mind that is always learningA highly creative mind that finds unique, bold and effective solutions to problemsAbility to shift thinking from company level to programmatic level to individual deliverablesSolid experience consulting with executives and managers on real-time problemsAbility to work on different types of work rapidly; ability to pivot quicklyHighly relationalSkilled presenter, facilitator and communicatorHigh level of ownership in work; ability to design and see things through from strategy to detailsDemonstrated ability to drive change in a complex organization
